cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles west of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest along the west coast of Florida, expected to turn north then northeast across the north Florida Gulf Coast and the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast near the Steinhatchee River/Big Bend area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from the west of Ochlockonee River, FL, to Indian Pass, FL and from the mouth of St. Marys River, GA, to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning west coast of Florida from Flamingo to Ochlockonee River; Storm Surge Warning Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, Florida west coast, Florida Big Bend, then coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy with outer-band gusts possibly reaching tropical-storm force (30–40 mph); sustained TS winds are unlikely (14 % chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of the peninsula near Port Canaveral.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could drop 2–4 inches with locally up to 6 inches, producing brief street/terminal flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes embedded in rain bands and dangerous rip-currents along the Atlantic beaches.
